section_title: Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty/Partial Knee Replacement (Evidence: pg no: 4, L180)
names: Unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 2, L81)
Partial knee replacement (Evidence: pg no: 4, L181)
description: Elective medial or lateral unicompartmental knee arthroplasty/partial knee replacement (Evidence: pg no: 4, L181-L182)
scope: Knee arthroplasty for single compartment (Evidence: pg no: 4, L181-L182)

documentation: Osteoarthritis isolated to the medial or lateral knee compartment with no degenerative changes in the opposite compartment (Evidence: pg no: 4, L183-L184)
Intact anterior cruciate ligament or documentation of stable knee examination (Evidence: pg no: 4, L185-L186)
Less than 10 degrees of fixed varus deformity for medial UKA (Evidence: pg no: 4, L187)
Less than 15 degrees of valgus deformity for lateral UKA (Evidence: pg no: 4, L188)
Failure of at least 3 months of non-surgical conservative treatments (Evidence: pg no: 4, L189-L191)

exclusions: Moderate-to-severe degenerative changes of the lateral facet of the patellofemoral joint when considering medial compartment replacement (Kellgren-Lawrence grade 3 or 4) (Evidence: pg no: 4, L196-L197)
Anterior cruciate ligament deficiency (Evidence: pg no: 4, L198)
Flexion contracture greater than 15 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 4, L199)
Fixed varus deformity greater than 10 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 4, L200)
Fixed valgus deformity greater than 15 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 4, L201)
Flexion less than 110 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 4, L202)
Previous meniscectomy in another compartment (Evidence: pg no: 4, L203)

codes.description: Arthroplasty, knee, condyle and plateau; medial OR lateral compartment (Evidence: pg no: 7, L301)

notes: UKA may be done with concurrent ACL reconstruction if all other criteria are met (Evidence: pg no: 4, L185-L186)
